definitions.definition: A good thing; a thing to be thankful for or to appreciate duly.
examples: Finding the dry cave was a boon to the weary travellers.
Anaesthetics are a great boon to modern surgery.

definitions.definition: ( archaic ) That which is asked or granted as a benefit or favor ; a gift or benefaction .
( British , dialectal ) An unpaid service due by a tenant to his lord.
( Hindu mythology ) A blessing, typically a supernatural power, granted to an ascetic by a god or goddess.

main_definition: A good thing; a thing to be thankful for or to appreciate duly.
secondary_definitions: ( archaic ) That which is asked or granted as a benefit or favor ; a gift or benefaction .
( British , dialectal ) An unpaid service due by a tenant to his lord.
( Hindu mythology ) A blessing, typically a supernatural power, granted to an ascetic by a god or goddess.

definitions.definition: The woody portion of flax , separated from the fiber as refuse matter by retting , braking , and scutching .

main_definition: The woody portion of flax , separated from the fiber as refuse matter by retting , braking , and scutching .
